content.description: Adventure zig-zag traverse under the large roof! Choose either the left or right side of the pillar to access the massive roof. Traverse right and stay on your feet placing tricky gear. Eventually exit straight up and out on the right end. Walk off or traverse right to the anchor above Feels Like Summer. (WARNING: there is some wicked rope drag on this one!)
content.protection: Gear to 3". Tricky but good finger sized placements under the roof.

content.description:
A Bobby Model creation that sat for a few years whilst the young, motivated and strong lads of Cody’s mid to late nineties climbing scene gave it their best efforts. Eventually, local strongman Nathan Manley took down the rig.  Successful attempts from locals Leif Gasch and BJ Tilden followed. Although one of the early instances of blatant manufacturing of rock climbing routes in the Cody climbing scene, many regard it as a tasteful artificial artistic contribution as opposed the tasteless, unnecessarily drilling of unnecessary holds to the right of this route many years later.

It’s bouldering on a rope. Go do it.
content.location: On the eastern end of the Bridge Bands, the walls are taller, and more continuous than the central and west end. Of that eastern section is an obvious section that is severely undercut at the bottom. Right out the center of that bulge is the renowned Bobby’s Bulge.
